com.yworks.yfiles.view.input

Class CreateBendInputMode

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yworks.yfiles.view.input.CreateBendInputMode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IInputMode

    public class CreateBendInputMode
extends Object
implements IInputMode
    An IInputMode used for recognizing the gesture of creating IBends in an IGraph.

    This mode is used by GraphEditorInputMode but can be used stand-alone, too. Client code should register with the BendCreated event to perform additional actions after the bend has been created.

    This mode is Exclusive by default.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CreateBendInputMode()
      Creates a new instance that will use the IGraph from the InputModeContext to create bends in.

      • arm

        protected void arm()
        Called when a bend creation gesture can be started at the current mouse pointer location.

        This implementation sets the PreferredCursor to ArmedCursor.

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Cancels the editing of this mode.

        This implementation releases the mutex if it is currently owned by this instance and calls onCanceled().

        Specified by:
        cancel in interface IInputMode
        See Also:
        onCanceled()

      • createBend

        protected IBend createBend(IEdge edge,
                           PointD location)
        Creates the bend.

        The bend is created using the hit edge's IBendCreator implementation, as obtained from the edge's ILookup.lookup(Class).

        Parameters:
        edge - The hit edge.
        location - The coordinates of the hit.
        Returns:
        The created bend or null.
        See Also:
        createInputModeContext()

      • createInputModeContext

        protected IInputModeContext createInputModeContext()
        Creates an IInputModeContext for use with the upcoming IBendCreator.createBend(IInputModeContext, IGraph, IEdge, PointD) call in createBend(IEdge, PointD).
        Returns:
        An instance of IInputModeContext.

      • disarm

        protected void disarm()
        Called when a bend creation gesture can no longer be started at the current mouse pointer location.

        This implementation sets the PreferredCursor back to null.

      • dragSegment

        protected void dragSegment(IEdge edge,
                           PointD dragLocation)
        Updates the OrthogonalSegmentSplittingEnabled property and then delegates to createBend(IEdge, PointD).

        This method triggers the BendCreated event if a bend is created.

        Parameters:
        edge - The edge to create a bend for.
        dragLocation - The location at which the user initiated the gesture.

      • getInputModeContext

        public final IInputModeContext getInputModeContext()
        Description copied from interface: IInputMode
        Returns the context instance this mode is currently installed in or null if this instance is not installed.

        Note that this instance should not be passed down to subordinate modes or instances. Instead a corresponding context that has this instance set as the ParentInputMode should be used.

        Specified by:
        getInputModeContext in interface IInputMode
        Returns:
        The InputModeContext.

      • getMovedRecognizerTouch

        public final IEventRecognizer getMovedRecognizerTouch()
        Gets the "moved" state recognizer specifically for touch input.

        This recognizer instance will be used to determine when the user begins actually moves the selection. The default value is TouchEventRecognizers.TOUCH_MOVED_PRIMARY.

        Returns:
        The touch move recognizer.
        See Also:
        setMovedRecognizerTouch(IEventRecognizer)

      • getPrepareRecognizerTouch

        public final IEventRecognizer getPrepareRecognizerTouch()
        Gets the "pressed" state recognizer specifically for touch input.

        This recognizer instance will be used to determine when the user begins to move the selection. The default value is TouchEventRecognizers.TOUCH_LONG_PRESSED_PRIMARY.

        Returns:
        The "pressed" recognizer.
        See Also:
        setPrepareRecognizerTouch(IEventRecognizer)

      • getPressedRecognizer

        Returns:
        The "pressed" recognizer.
        See Also:

      • getPriority

        public final int getPriority()
        Description copied from interface: IInputMode
        The priority of this input mode.

        The priority will influence the order in which the modes will be installed into the canvas control. The lower the priority value, the earlier it will be installed. If two modes are installed using the same priority value, the first one will be installed earlier.

        Specified by:
        getPriority in interface IInputMode
        Returns:
        The Priority.

      • getReleasedRecognizer

        public final IEventRecognizer getReleasedRecognizer()
        Gets the "released" recognizer.

        This instance determines when the user has finished the move.

        Returns:
        The "released" recognizer.
        See Also:
        setReleasedRecognizer(IEventRecognizer)

      • getReleasedRecognizerTouch

        public final IEventRecognizer getReleasedRecognizerTouch()
        Gets the "released" state recognizer specifically for touch input.

        This recognizer instance will be used to determine when the finalized the gesture. The default value is TouchEventRecognizers.TOUCH_UP_PRIMARY.

        Returns:
        The touch released recognizer.
        See Also:
        setReleasedRecognizerTouch(IEventRecognizer)

      • getSplitOrthogonalSegmentRecognizer

        public final IEventRecognizer getSplitOrthogonalSegmentRecognizer()
        Gets the event recognizer that determines whether the bend creation should be treated as a split segment operation.
        Returns:
        The event recognizer that determines whether orthogonal edge segments should be split during the bend creation.
        See Also:
        setSplitOrthogonalSegmentRecognizer(IEventRecognizer)

      • install

        public void install(IInputModeContext context,
                    ConcurrencyController controller)
        Installs this mode into the given context that is provided by the canvas.

        In general a mode can only be installed into a single canvas at all times.

        This method is called to initialize this instance. Subclasses should override this method to register the corresponding event handler delegates for the various input events they need to register with.

        Overriding implementations should call the base implementation, first.

        Specified by:
        install in interface IInputMode
        Parameters:
        context - The context that this instance shall be installed into. The same instance will be passed to this instance during IInputMode.uninstall(IInputModeContext). A reference to the context may be kept and queried during the time the mode is installed.
        controller - The Controller for this mode.
        See Also:
        IInputMode.uninstall(IInputModeContext)

      • isBendReusingEnabled

        public final boolean isBendReusingEnabled()
        Gets a property that determines whether this mode should use an existing bend in createBend(IEdge, PointD) if there is one found at the given location.

        The default is true

        Returns:
        The BendReusingEnabled.
        See Also:
        setBendReusingEnabled(boolean)

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Gets the enabled state of this input mode.

        Clients can use this property to disable or reenable this instance. This will set the Enabled property of the installed Controller so a disabled instance should never try to acquire the input mutex.

        Returns:
        The Enabled.
        See Also:
        setEnabled(boolean)

      • isExclusive

        public final boolean isExclusive()
        Gets a value indicating whether this mode will be the only one running when it has the mutex.

        The value of this property will be delegated to the Exclusive property of the Controller.

        If this mode is marked as exclusive and has the mutex, all other modes added to the same MultiplexingInputMode will be deactivated. Otherwise it will always run concurrently with all other modes.

        Returns:
        The Exclusive.
        See Also:
        setExclusive(boolean)

      • isOrthogonalSegmentSplittingEnabled

        public final boolean isOrthogonalSegmentSplittingEnabled()
        Gets a value indicating whether an orthogonal segment should be split by the last bend creation.

        This property can be read by implementations of IBendCreator if they retrieve this instance from their ParentInputMode. If this property is true, implementation are advised to treat the bend creation as a gesture that splits the segment into two.

        Returns:
        The OrthogonalSegmentSplittingEnabled.
        See Also:
        getSplitOrthogonalSegmentRecognizer(), setOrthogonalSegmentSplittingEnabled(boolean)

        protected boolean isValidBegin(Object source,
                               IEventArgs args)

      • onCanceled

        protected void onCanceled()
        Called after cancel() has been called.

        Can be overridden in subclasses to perform additional actions after the mode has been canceled.

        This implementation does nothing.

      • onConcurrencyControllerActivated

        protected void onConcurrencyControllerActivated()
        Called after the Active property of the installed ConcurrencyController has been set to true.

        Can be overridden in subclasses to perform additional actions after the mode has been activated.

        Overriding implementations should call the base implementation.

        protected void onConcurrencyControllerDeactivated()
        Called after the Active property of the installed ConcurrencyController has been set to false.

        Can be overridden in subclasses to perform additional actions after the mode has been deactivated.

        Overriding implementations should call the base implementation.

        public final void setExclusive(boolean value)
        Sets a value indicating whether this mode will be the only one running when it has the mutex.

        The value of this property will be delegated to the Exclusive property of the Controller.

        If this mode is marked as exclusive and has the mutex, all other modes added to the same MultiplexingInputMode will be deactivated. Otherwise it will always run concurrently with all other modes.

        protected final void setOrthogonalSegmentSplittingEnabled(boolean value)
        Sets a value indicating whether an orthogonal segment should be split by the last bend creation.

      • setPriority

        public final void setPriority(int value)
        The priority of this input mode.

        The priority will influence the order in which the modes will be installed into the canvas control. The lower the priority value, the earlier it will be installed. If two modes are installed using the same priority value, the first one will be installed earlier.

        Parameters:
        value - The Priority to set.
        See Also:
        getPriority()

      • stop

        public boolean stop()
        Description copied from interface: IInputMode
        Called by the client in order to stop a current editing progress.

        This should stop the current edit, if one is in progress and possibly commit all of the changes. If stopping is not possible, this method can return false

        Specified by:
        stop in interface IInputMode
        Returns:
        true if and only if the editing has been stopped or there was no edit in progress
        See Also:
        IInputMode.cancel()

      • uninstall

        public void uninstall(IInputModeContext context)
        Uninstalls this mode from the given context.

        This code should clean up all changes made to the canvas in the IInputMode.install(IInputModeContext, ConcurrencyController) method. After a mode has been uninstalled it can be installed again into the same or another canvas.

        Overriding implementations should call the base implementation after their own code.

        Specified by:
        uninstall in interface IInputMode
        Parameters:
        context - The context to deregister from. This is the same instance that had been passed to IInputMode.install(IInputModeContext, ConcurrencyController) during installation.
